Sentencas: Solid oxide cells (SOCs) convert the energy of a fuel to electrical energy (fuel cell mode) and electrical energy into a fuel such as hydrogen (electrolysis mode) with exceptionally high efficiencies (>60% and >90%, respectively).

Sentencas: They are flexible in terms of usable fuels & gasses and operating modes such as dynamic and reversible.

Sentencas: Therefore, SOCs can be a solution for the intermittent nature of renewable energy sources, which are increasingly implemented in modern energy systems.
